  • numpy.lib.NumpyVersion

numpy.lib.NumpyVersionÂ¶

class numpy.lib.NumpyVersion(vstring)[source]Â¶

Parse and compare numpy version strings.

NumPy has the following versioning scheme (numbers given are examples; they can be > 9) in principle):

  • Released version: â€˜1.8.0â€™, â€˜1.8.1â€™, etc.

  • Alpha: â€˜1.8.0a1â€™, â€˜1.8.0a2â€™, etc.

  • Beta: â€˜1.8.0b1â€™, â€˜1.8.0b2â€™, etc.

  • Release candidates: â€˜1.8.0rc1â€™, â€˜1.8.0rc2â€™, etc.

  • Development versions: â€˜1.8.0.dev-f1234afaâ€™ (git commit hash appended)

  • Development versions after a1: â€˜1.8.0a1.dev-f1234afaâ€™,

    â€˜1.8.0b2.dev-f1234afaâ€™, â€˜1.8.1rc1.dev-f1234afaâ€™, etc.

  • Development versions (no git hash available): â€˜1.8.0.dev-Unknownâ€™

Comparing needs to be done against a valid version string or other NumpyVersion instance. Note that all development versions of the same (pre-)release compare equal.

New in version 1.9.0.

Parameters
vstringstr

NumPy version string (np.__version__).

Examples

>>> from numpy.lib import NumpyVersion
>>> if NumpyVersion(np.__version__) < '1.7.0':
...     print('skip')
skip

>>> NumpyVersion('1.7')  # raises ValueError, add ".0"
